Essay High Altitudes, Violent Lands Mountainous regions are home to just 10% of the world’s population—and many of its ugliest and most persistent wars By Judith Matloff Feb. 23, 2017 11:41 a.m. ET 
Try this exercise: On a globe, chart all the places that have endured major conflicts—rebellions, terrorist campaigns, civil wars and more conventional ones—over the past half-century. Next, run your hand over the surface of the map and check the altitude key. You will find a striking pattern: elevation.
